sub_title: Project Manager, Service Management System Manager, Risk Manager, Project Portfolio Management
summary:
I'm an experienced Project Management lead with a demonstrated history of working with the information technology and services industry. I have strong professional skills in Project and Portfolio Management, Risk Management, Quality Management, IT Service Management and Operations Management. I have long working experience in large and small international projects in European Union programmes Horizon 2020 and Horizon Europe. 

My main achievements: 
● Coordinating from the start the implementation of ISO 9001:2015, ISO/IEC 20000-1:2018 standards 
> Achieving organizational ISO9001 and ISO/IEC 20000-1 certification in 2018
> Performing the role of the service management system manager since 2016
● Coordinating from the start the implementation of Project Management Office (documentation and staff training)
> Achieving within 1,5 year full implementation of ISO9001 for Project portfolio and project management, recognized by successful organizational certification
> Increase the number of proposal success rate from 37% to 64%
> Increase the number of active projects by a factor of 3

treasury_media.title: PM C1 - PM² Essentials, Project Management Methodology

treasury_media.title: Case Study - FitSM for EOSC-hub
treasury_media.description: During EOSC-hub project I had a privilege to work as Service Management System Manager with a goal to define a initial set up for EOSC (European Open Science Cloud Infrastructure) Service management System following FitSM standard.

treasury_media.title: EGI-Foundation ISO/IEC 20000-1
treasury_media.description: Since 2017 EGI Foundation is certified for ISO/IEC 2000-1:2011 (later on ISO/IEC 2000-1:2011) standard and I have an honored to be assigned as Service management system manager to work towards certification and maintain it for so many years.

treasury_media.title: EGI-Foundation ISO 9001
treasury_media.description: Since 2017 EGI Foundation is certified for ISO 9001:2015 standard and I have an honored to be assigned as Service management system manager to work towards certification and maintain it for so many years. In 2022 Project management activities also passed the certification to complement service delivery activities.

projects.title: interTwin
projects.description: High energy physics, radio astronomy, astroparticle physics, climate research, environmental monitoring, all are expected to significantly advance the state of the art of modelling and simulation. The EU-funded interTwin project will codesign and implement the prototype of an interdisciplinary digital twin engine. This open-source platform will provide generic and tailored software components for modelling and simulation to integrate application-specific digital twins. The goal is to develop a common approach that is applicable across the whole spectrum of scientific disciplines to facilitate developments and collaboration. As a result, a consolidation of software technologies supporting research will emerge

projects.title: EOSC Synergy
projects.description:
EOSC-synergy extends the EOSC coordination to nine participating countries by harmonizing policies and federating relevant national research e-Infrastructures, scientific data and thematic services, bridging the gap between national initiatives and EOSC.

The project introduces new capabilities by opening national thematic services to European access, thus expanding the EOSC offer in the Environment, Climate Change, Earth Observation and Life Sciences. This will be supported by an expansion of the capacity through the federation of compute, storage and data resources aligned with the EOSC and FAIR policies and practices.

contributors.headline: Project Manager, Service Management System Manager, Risk Manager, Project Portfolio Management

projects.title: EGI-ACE
projects.description: EGI-ACE is an EU-funded project coordinated by the EGI Foundation with a mission to empower researchers from all disciplines to collaborate on data- and compute-intensive research through free-at-point-of-use services. Building on the distributed computing integration in the EOSC-hub project, EGI-ACE will deliver the EOSC Compute Platform and contribute to the EOSC Data Commons through a federation of cloud compute and storage facilities, PaaS services and data spaces with analytics tools and federated access services. Over 30 months, the project is expected to provide more than 82 million CPU hours, 250 thousand GPU hours for data processing and analytics, and 45 PB/month for hosting and exploiting research data.

projects.title: EOSC-hub - Integrating and managing services for the European Open Science Cloud
projects.description: The EOSC-hub project creates the integration and management system (the Hub) of the future European Open Science Cloud that delivers a catalogue of services, software and data from the EGI Federation, EUDAT CDI, INDIGO-DataCloud and major research e-Infrastructures. The Hub builds on mature processes, policies and tools from the leading European federated e-Infrastructures to cover the whole life-cycle of services, from planning to delivery. The Hub aggregates services from local, regional and national e-Infrastructures in Europe and worldwide.

projects.title: Implementing service management in federated e-Infrastructure  (FedSM)
projects.description:
European Commission (VII Framework Programme) under contract number 312851.

Service Management in Federated e-Infrastructure FedSM is a collaborative, European project with the primary goal of formalising IT Service Management (ITSM) and introducing industry-standards-based ITSM processes in Federated e-Infrastructures.

Strategy | Innovation | Communications | Open Science

projects.title: “EGI-InSPIRE", INFSO-RI-261323
projects.description: The EGI-INSPIRE project aimed to establish a sustainable European Grid Infrastructure (EGI) by bringing together National Grid Initiatives (NGIs) and other organisations across the EU. It was a collaborative effort involving more than 50 institutions. The original impetus for EGI-INSPIRE was the heavy computational requirements of big data users at CERN, the European Organisation for Nuclear Research, where physicists adopted the paradigm of distributed computing worldwide to solve their big data problems. They used EGI to analyse the data from the Large Hadron Collider that led to the discovery of the elusive Higgs boson.

projects.title: “EGEE III - Enabling Grids for E-sciencE", INFSO RI 222667
projects.description: EGEE-III project has two clear objectives that are essential for European research infrastructures: to expand, optimize and simplify the use of  Europe's largest production Grid by continuous operation of the infrastructure, support for more user communities, and addition of further computational and data resources; to prepare the migration of the existing Grid from a project-based model to a sustainable federated infrastructure based on National Grid Initiatives.

profile_positions.description:
Project Management Lead responsibilities:
● I designed and I am contributing to the definition and the implementation of the EGI Project Portfolio.
 * I am responsible for the effective and efficient implementation of projects coordinated and participated by EGI F.
 * I set up and run the Project Portfolio management (calls' selection, proposal writing and internal coordination of related activities)
 * I coordinate HR allocation to awarded projects.
 * I contribute to the selection of projects calls of strategic importance
 * I defined Portfolio and Project Management best practices by creating and maintaining knowledge database
● I liaise with 
 *  the EC and other funding agencies to support formulation of future funding EC programmes.
 * EGI Participants and Partners to gather interests and support their participation in project proposals.
 * External partners representing EGI in externally lead consortia.
● I lead the Project Management Team: recruitment, well-being, performance assessment, growth planning etc.

Project Manager (interTwin project - Machine learning, Digital Twin, Artificial Intelligence) responsibilities:
● I'm taking care of strategic, administrative and financial project management activities
● I define and negotiate Consortium agreements
● I monitor and support resolving issues and conflicts
● I chair a number of project governance bodies 

SMS Manager responsibilities:  
● I act as the primary contact point for all tactical concerns (including planning and development) in the context of the Service Management System
● I define, maintain and implement the service management strategy and plan
● I ensure that processes are implemented according to approved goals and policies, including planning and organizing internal and external audits
● I act as a consultant for process owners and process managers.

Trainer, consultant and an auditor for ITSM (FitSM) and ISO27001 standard.
profile_positions.title: Project Management Lead, Project Manager, Service Management System Manager, Risk Manager

profile_positions.description:
I was supporting execution of the EGI Foundation strategy by ensuring that the products and services the EGI Foundation provides were fit for purpose, were of agreed quality, were consistent and meet both external and internal requirements by setting up and managing EGI Service Management System. This included legal compliance and customer expectations.
Responsibilities:
● I developed and managed Service Management System according to ISO 9001:2015, ISO/IEC 20000-1:2011 standards
● I was leading the definition and execution of the EGI Foundation quality & risk management procedures, standards and specifications within the company and projects
● I was performing role of  Service Level Management (set up, definition and review of agreements SLAs) and Service Reporting Manager (set up, definition and review of service reports) for all services
● I was a consultant, trainer, auditor (ISO 19011) in: FitSM standard (service management), ISO/IEC 27001 (information security)
● I developed and implemented a consistent and standardized process for project management within the EGI Foundation
● I administered JIRA and Confluence, and coordinated the creation of the internal knowledge database
profile_positions.title: Quality and Risk Manager, Service Management System Manager, SLM and SRM Manager

profile_positions.description:
I was a member of Operations team.
Responsibilities:
● I coordinated implementation and execution of EGI Service Management System, which aimed to improve EGI service delivery and quality of its services based on FitSM standard
● I was a ITSM standard Trainer delivering FitSM standard trainings
● I coordinated the design and implementation of quality and risk management processes for company and projects
● I supported project managers within the project by ensuring the quality and risk management activities
● I led activities towards the definition and maintenance of operational procedures, best practices and policies. It lead to redesign of external and internal documentation and improvement of accessibility and readability. 
● I performed a role of project work package leader responsible for coordination of EGI Production Infrastructure by supervising the operational status and advancement of global and national operational services, collecting operational requirements, defining the operations technical roadmap and supervising its progress
● I was assigned as project task leader responsible for coordinating integration and delivery of Cloud resources and services through the EGI IaaS Cloud Infrastructure Platform
● I developed a technical relationship with European Research Infrastructures promoting and gathering IT requirements and information on their use cases around the adoption of EGI’s Core Infrastructure services and EGI Cloud Infrastructure Platform, achieving long term relationship between ERIs and EGI.
profile_positions.title: Senior Operations Officer

profile_positions.description:
Member of Grid operation and oversight of the e-Infrastructure global task in European Grid Infrastructure (EGI) .                
Responsibilities:
● Detecting and coordinating diagnosis of problems affecting the entire e-Infrastructure; reporting of middleware issues, execution of quality checks of the provided services
● Handling of operational problems at global level and coordination of software installation 
● Supervising compatibility between projects in terms of monitoring/accounting/helpdesk/trouble handling issues and operational procedures
● Providing grid oversight activity, supervising regional technical support team and defining requirements for tools
● Implementing ITIL v3 recommendations
● Defining and implementing new model of operation and identifying requirements of teams, regions and resource centres
● Defining a scalable model of resources allocation for the infrastructure, applicable to large and to small Research communities 
● Collaboration manager between EGEE/EGI and PL-Grid project
